N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 800.9 - Access to shipping record and payment of bills

State Regulations
(a) Steamship agents, owners and masters will
be required to furnish or permit access to the manifestos of cargo and railroad
documents by the authorized representatives of the Commission for the purpose
of ascertaining the necessary data to permit assignment of facilities and
correct estimate of charges. (b) All
vessels, their owners or agents, using the wharfs or facilities shall, within
three days after the sailing of the vessel in the case of outward cargo, or
within three days after the arrival of vessels in the case of inward cargo, furnish the commission or its authorized representative with all necessary
documents to enable the proper preparation and auditing of bills covering
dockage, wharfage or any other attendant services or fees chargeable by the
commission against said vessel. (c) All stevedores or other persons, firms or corporations using any facilities or
equipment of the commission, shall, unless otherwise provided by existing
contracts, pay all bills within 15 days of date of mailing to them by the
commission; failing to do this, they shall be placed upon the delinquent list
and denied further use of the equipment or facilities under the jurisdiction of
the commission until said bills have been paid, or permission obtained from the
commission. Bills must be paid as presented and errors, if any, will be
rectified by the commission. Notes
